szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena

Class ActorGameProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.PlayerGameProxy
      • szakacs.kpi.fei.tuke.arena.ActorGameProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorManagerBasic, ActorManagerUpdatable, GameLevelBasic, GameLevelUpdatable, PlayerManagerBasic, PlayerManagerUpdatable, ActorGameInterface, PlayerGameInterface

    public class ActorGameProxy
extends PlayerGameProxy
implements ActorGameInterface
    An extension od the PlayerGameProxy class implementing the ActorGameInterface interface for use by actors to access game functionality.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MethodCallAuthenticator getAuthenticator()
      Gets the authenticator object to be used to verify the caller of a method with a signature containing an Object authToken in their signatures by passing the authenticator to the method as that parameter.
      GameWorldUpdatable getGameWorld()
      Gets the game world of this level.
      java.util.Map<PlayerToken,Pipe> getPipesUpdatable()
      Gets a set of currently active (not destroyed) pipes identified by the token of the player that owns them.
      java.util.Map<PlayerToken,PlayerInfo> getPlayerTokenMap()
      Gets a set of currently active players and associated info about them identified by their tokens.
      void registerActor(ActorPrivileged actor, java.lang.Runnable action)
      Registers an actor, thereby adding the actor to the game level.
      void unregisterActor(ActorBasic actor)
      Unregisters an actor (removing from it from the game, in the sense that its act() method is no longer called), Note that the actual implementation can use late removal to prevent ConcurrentModificationException.

      • registerActor

        public void registerActor(ActorPrivileged actor,
                          java.lang.Runnable action)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerUpdatable
        Registers an actor, thereby adding the actor to the game level. Also optionally sets a method (an action) that is to be called (performed) when the actor given as argument is unregistered, that is, removed from the game level.
        Specified by:
        registerActor in interface ActorManagerUpdatable
        Parameters:
        actor - Not Null: The actor to add to the game level.
        action - Optional: The action to be performed when the actor is unregistered, Must be a reference to a method returning void and taking no arguments or null if nothing is to be performed on a given actors removal.

      • unregisterActor

        public void unregisterActor(ActorBasic actor)
        Description copied from interface: ActorManagerUpdatable
        Unregisters an actor (removing from it from the game, in the sense that its act() method is no longer called), Note that the actual implementation can use late removal to prevent ConcurrentModificationException. Optionally also executes a method that is to be called when the actor is unregistered if such a method has been set, otherwise it does nothing.
        Specified by:
        unregisterActor in interface ActorManagerUpdatable
        Parameters:
        actor - Not Null: The actor to remove
